channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Donald Jr. and Eric Trump Pursue New Deals That Would Enrich President Trump
item.description: The president’s older sons, Donald Trump Jr. and Eric Trump, spent the past two weeks traveling the world and announcing deals, many of which will fin...

item.title: The Trump Family Cashes In, and Why Chatbots Are Wrong More Than Ever
Gail Collins and Bret Stephens: A Last Conversation
item.description: After eight years of weekly chats, one more for the road.

item.title: Investors on hold for Fed Chair Powell’s speech as strong data boosts stocks globally
item.description: Buying momentum continued in Asia and European stock markets today, but all eyes are on Jerome Powell's upcoming commentary.

item.title: Meet the man Warren Buffett trusts with his $1.2 trillion empire
item.description: Greg Abel is expected to take the helm at Berkshire Hathaway as the Buffett era draws nigh.

item.title: As the mighty Permian Basin slows, Canada stands to rise in the shale oil and gas world
item.description: Kimmeridge activist investment firm eyes Canadian producers and new LNG projects.

item.title: Cardinal Erdo of Hungary Is a Favorite of Conservatives to Become Pope
item.description: The archbishop is a standard-bearer for those in the church who favor a return to traditional rules and doctrine after Pope Francis.

item.title: Virginia, Washington and Georgia want judges to force dangerous drivers to install car devices that stop them from speeding
item.description: New York and California also could soon tap the GPS-based technology to help combat a recent national spike in traffic deaths.

item.description: JPMorgan has redeployed most of Capital Connect’s 200 employees
